revision.text: ==English== ===Etymology=== From {{uder|en|fa|ÛŒØ§Ø±Ú©ÛŒ||power, strength, ability, boldness|tr=yÃ¢rakÃ®}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|en|/Ëˆja.É¹ak/|||qual1=General American}} ===Noun=== {{en-noun|-}} # {{lb|en|falconry}} A super-alert state where the bird is hungry, but not weak, with a trance like state of alertness and ready to [[hunt]]. #* {{quote-book|en|author=T[erence] H[anbury] White|authorlink=T. H. White|chapter=II|title={{w|The Once and Future King}}|location=New York, N.Y.|publisher={{w|G. P. Putnam's Sons}}|year=1958|section=book I (''The Sword in the Stone'')|isbn=978-0-399-10597-5|passage=Kay began walking off in the wrong direction, raging in his heart because he knew that he had flown the bird when he was not properly in '''yarak''', and the Wart had to shout after him the right way.}} ---- ==Kalasha== ===Etymology=== Ultimately borrowed from Old Turkic [[ğ°–ğ°ºğ°´]]â€ (yarak, â€œweaponâ€), from [[yar#Old Turkic|yar]]â€ (yar, â€œto split in twoâ€) +â€ [[-ak#Old Turkic|-ak]]â€ (-ak). ===Noun=== {{head|kls|noun}} # [[weapons]] ====Synonyms==== * {{l|kls|wasila}} ====Related terms==== * {{l|kls|badok}} 'axe' * {{l|kls|polat}} 'battle axe' * {{l|kls|tupanca}} 'revolver' * {{l|kls|tupec}} 'gun' * {{l|kls|rapal}} 'gun' * {{l|kls|tup}} 'cannon' * {{l|kls|politai}} 'rifle' * {{l|kls|mukai}} 'shotgun' * {{l|kls|gorai}} 'repeating rifle' * {{l|kls|yawbani}} 'single-shot rifle' ---- ==Turkish== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|tr|ota|ÙŠØ§Ø±Ø§Ù‚|tr=yarak|t=weapon}}, from {{der|tr|otk|ğ°–ğ°ºğ°´|tr=yarak|t=weapon}}, from {{compound|otk|yar|-ak|t1=to split in two|nocat=1}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|tr|[jÉ‘ËˆÉ¾É‘k]|[jÉ‘ËˆÉ¾ËÉ‘k]}} ===Noun=== {{tr-noun|yaraÄŸÄ±|lar}} # {{lb|tr|archaic}} [[weapon]] # {{lb|tr|vulgar}} [[penis]] ====Declension==== {{tr-infl-noun-c|a|stem=yaraÄŸ|poss=1}} ====Synonyms==== * {{l|tr|sik}} ====See also==== * {{l|tr|penis}} * {{l|tr|taÅŸak}} * {{l|tr|pipi}} * {{l|tr|Ã§Ã¼k}}
